 The Digital Workplace Advisory Group is a strategic practice unit established to help orchestrate the breadth of Infosys digital workplace service offerings across the technology service-lines, complemented with experience design, digital adoption & learning services to deliver an integrated and human-centric experience to our enterprise clients in their journey to the future of work. This team is responsible for driving integrated Go To Market incubating industry solutions, Managing Analyst Briefings & provide technology advisory services to Client execs in their digital transformation of workplace.
   

  

**Your role**
 In the role of Industry Principal, you would be part of team of digital workplace transformation leaders and evangelists on future of work who specialize in leading organizations through digital workplace transformation by leveraging emerging workplace technologies. You will work on customer engagements to define, sell and guide customers on initiatives in the areas of digital workplace strategy, employee experience transformation, workplace modernization, organizational change and smart workspace design.

* Provide technology advisory services to Client Executives on their digital workplace strategy & roadmap.

 Employee Experience, Modern Workplace and Endpoint Management, Digital Collaboration (Team Collaboration , Cloud Voice & Meeting & Collaborative Apps ), DaaS & Device lifecycle Management (Modern device and endpoint management, Cloud Virtual Desktops, Device Analytics & experience management ), Connected Workspaces ( IoT, AR/VR ), Workplace Security), Digital Adoption & Change Management ( incl. Workplace Analytics), Service desk & experience, ( incl. Conversational AI & Automation).

title: Presales Consultant STRATA
description:
**Our Mission**
 At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:
   

  

 Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
   

  

 Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.
   

  

**Who We Are**
 We take our mission of protecting the digital way of life seriously. We are relentless in protecting our customers and we believe that the unique ideas of every member of our team contributes to our collective success. Our values were crowdsourced by employees and are brought to life through each of us everyday - from disruptive innovation and collaboration, to execution. From showing up for each other with integrity to creating an environment where we all feel included.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you will be shaping the future of cybersecurity. We work fast, value ongoing learning, and we respect each employee as a unique individual. Knowing we all have different needs, our development and personal wellbeing programs are designed to give you choice in how you are supported. This includes our FLEXBenefits wellbeing spending account with over 1,000 eligible items selected by employees, our mental and financial health resources, and our personalized learning opportunities - just to name a few!
   

  

**Job Description**
**Your Career**
 As a Presales Domain Consultant STRATA for network security transformation, you provide technical expertise and guidance in customers' network security and zero trust journey. You will be key in defining technical solutions that secure a customer’s key business imperatives. You evangelize our industry leadership in on-prem, cloud, and security services that establish Palo Alto Networks as a customer’s cybersecurity partner.
   

  

**Your Impact**
* Collaborate with sales teams to recommend and develop customer solutions within your assigned specialization
* Architect solutions that will help our customers strengthen and simplify their security posture
* Present to customers as our expert at all levels in the customer hierarchy, from practitioner to senior leadership
* Lead and support customer demonstrations that showcase our unique value proposition
* Responsible for prospective customers and partners' Technical Validation projects based on best practices to ensure technical win in assigned opportunities
* Document high-level design and key use cases to ensure proper implementation and value realization of Palo Alto Networks solutions
* Lead conversations about industry trends and emerging changes to the security landscape
* Responsible for discussing and highlighting product alignment with customer requirements and differentiation
* As the main technical point of contact for Network Security, you will assist and collaborate to respond effectively to RFIs/RFPs
* Position Palo Alto Networks or Partner delivered services as appropriate to ensure proper implementation and value realization of Palo Alto Networks solutions
* Discuss, with credibility, competitive offers in the marketplace and position ours as the best alternative


**Qualifications**
**Your Experience**
* Multiple years of specialist experience in pre-sales/sales engineering within one or more of the following specialisms - Zero Trust, SaaS Security, SSE/SASE, Networking or Network Security
* Being the expert addition to the technical sales function
* Solid understanding of NGFW, Network Security, SASE, SD-WAN, CASB, Proxy, DLP and BYOD Solutions
* Experience in working with customers, demonstrating problem-solving skills and a can-do attitude
* Business fluent in Swedish and English


**Additional Information**
**The Team**
 Our Domain Consultant team members work hand-in-hand with organizations around the world to keep their digital environments protected. We educate, inspire,and empower our potential clients in their journey to security.
   

  

 You are empowered with unmatched systems and tools and a team built on joint success. You won’t find someone at Palo Alto Networks that isn’t committed to your success – with everyone pitching in to assist when it comes to solutions selling, learning, and development. Our Solutions Consulting community is driven by the mission to be our customers’ cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting their digital way of life.
   

  

**Our Commitment**
 We’re problem solvers that take risks and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
   

  

 We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.
   

  

 Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: AI Engineer
description:
**Filed is building the first AI tax preparer trusted by America’s accounting firms.**
 This industry might seem boring,but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it. Fast.
   

  

 In just 9 months, we’ve hit strong product-market fit, are generating insanely fast-growing, ridiculously sticky revenue, and are backed by top-tier investors. We’re not a tool—we’re the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We’re building the future by expanding our already 30-person team with those who want to say “I was there when it all started.”
   

  

 Read more → TechCrunch
   

  

 ⸻
   

  

**What We Should Tell You About The Role**
 This role sits at the heart of how we turn complex, human tax reasoning into scalable intelligence. You’ll be building the brain of the first AI tax preparer trusted by America’s accounting firms. Your work will touch everything from retrieval pipelines to model evaluation to how our system thinks about a single user query. This is not a narrow research role—it’s applied, fast-moving, and deeply interdisciplinary. You’ll partner with product, engineering, and domain experts to ship features that real firms rely on daily, balancing cutting-edge AI with the rigor and reliability that compliance demands.
   

  

**Here’s why this is a terrible job**
 This isn’t for someone who likes to move slow. We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we’re wrong, but more often we’re right—and we course-correct fast. If you need extra days to perfect your model, teammates will be waiting on you. We use tools like Cursor, OpenAI, and Gemini to prototype fast, test in prod, and push to users in hours, not quarters. You’ll work at the intersection of LLMs, user behavior, compliance, and knowledge graphs, with no clean datasets or perfect answers—just judgment calls and chaos. You’ll ask yourself,
 *is this really the work?* 
 It is. And it’s not for everyone.
   

  

* and here’s why it’s the best career choice you’ll make


 We’re hyperscaling, well-funded, and hit strong product-market fit in nine months. We’re building what tax pros call impossible, a product that behaves like a teammate, not a tool. We run reviews every four months, operate with full transparency, and pay above market with fast-growing equity. You’ll own decisions, ship because you believe in what you build, and talk to users weekly. We’ll set the goal; how you get there;prompting, tuning, retrieval, structured data—is up to you. You’ll help build a customer oracle so sharp it predicts what users need before they do.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Responsible For**
 You’ll design and implement LLM-powered workflows across tax, finance, and compliance, building agentic frameworks with tools like adk, LangChain, and CrewAI. You’ll develop scalable knowledge systems for memory, retrieval, and reasoning, and own prompt pipelines, vector stores, fine-tuned models, and evals. You’ll think in systems, probabilities, and second-order effects as you work across ambiguous problem spaces that blend LLMs, APIs, and semi-structured data. You’ll become an internal Oracle, building a deep mental model of our users so precise it can predict what they need before they ask.
   

  

**The teammate we’re looking for**
 You thrive on complexity and get energized by the edge cases most people avoid. You’re pragmatic—fast to ship, faster to learn—and you believe research only matters when it drives outcomes. You’re fluent in tools like OpenAI, Gemini, and Claude, comfortable writing production-grade Python, and confident working across cloud environments like GCP or Azure. You grasp embeddings, RAG, and retrieval at scale, and may have built internal tooling for model debugging or evals. You collaborate deeply across product, engineering, and operations, stay curious about everything you automate, and take full ownership of outcomes. You love seeing your work in front of real users daily—and improving it just as quickly.
   

  

**Growth And Levels**
* We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.
* We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.
* This isn’t a comfy lean-back role. It’s fast, focused, and customer-obsessed.
* You will launch fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.


**Equal Opportunity**
 Filed is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you’re excited about this role but don’t meet every single qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway as we’re building a team of people with diverse strengths, experiences, and backgrounds.
   

  

 Compensation Range: ₹20L - ₹24L

title: Customer Care Specialist
description:
We’re SignUp Software, the innovators behind ExFlow – a leading AP automation solution built for Microsoft Dynamics. We’re on a mission to make invoice processing smoother, faster, and smarter for businesses around the world. If you’re excited by tech, teamwork, and helping customers succeed — you’ll fit right in!
   

  

 🌟 About the Role
   

  

 We’re looking for a Customer Care Specialist to be the friendly first point of contact for our partners and customers. You’ll handle support inquiries, manage tickets, and make sure our clients feel heard, supported, and impressed every step of the way.
   

  

 Your superpower? Turning challenges into great experiences — with empathy, clear communication, and a can-do attitude.
   

  

 🎯 What You’ll Be Doing
   

  

* Be the go-to person for support inquiries and deliver fast, professional responses.
* Manage and prioritize tickets in our support system like a pro.
* Keep customers and partners updated with clear, friendly communication.
* Take a genuine interest in client needs — ask questions, dig deeper, and deliver real solutions.
* Work hand-in-hand with your teammates to resolve issues and keep our service top-notch.


 🧩 What You Bring
   

  

* A higher professional education (MBO) level or equivalent.
* 3–5 years of experience in customer support or a similar role.
* A natural curiosity for IT — experience with ERP systems is a plus
* Fluent in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.
* A customer-first mindset: you listen, solve problems, and take initiative.


 💡 Bonus Points For
   

  

* Experience with D365FO or other ERP platforms.
* Familiarity with customer success practices.


 🌍 What We Offer
   

  

* Be part of a fast-growing, globally recognized company.
* Work with helpful, talented colleagues from diverse backgrounds.
* Ongoing training and development opportunities.
* Flexible hours and hybrid work options.
* Attractive benefits and great working conditions.


**Important to note**
 We encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every listed requirement. Research shows that individuals from underrepresented groups, including women, often hesitate to apply for certain roles unless they meet every qualification. At SignUp Software, we value diverse perspectives, age groups, and experiences. Passion and potential are just as important as experience. If you're excited about what we do and feel you could make an impact, we want to hear from you. Let’s explore together if this opportunity is the right fit for you. Interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis throughout the process.
   

  

**About Us 🚀**
 SignUp Software was founded in 1999 and introduced ExFlow in 2003. Over the years, SignUp Software has earned a strong reputation in the Microsoft Dynamics community for its solutions in financial process automation. The solutions in the ExFlow product portfolio are built into Microsoft Dynamics 365 and utilize Azure Services, specifically designed for the “Office of the CFO” and the “Office of the COO”.
   

  

 SignUp Software currently operates from Sweden (where it is headquartered), Denmark, Netherlands, Germany, Spain, UK, USA, Canada, Singapore, Malaysia, and Australia, and has over 400 employees and partnerships with more than 100 resellers worldwide. Globally, over 1,500 customers rely on ExFlow to enhance their financial processes in more than 60 countries.
   

  

 SignUp Software was founded in 1999 and introduced ExFlow in 2003. Over the years, SignUp Software has earned a strong reputation in the Microsoft Dynamics community for its solutions in financial process automation. The solutions in the ExFlow product portfolio are built in Microsoft Dynamics 365 and utilize Azure Services, specifically designed for the “Office of the CFO”.

title: Sales Engineering Manager, Benelux & Nordics
description:
**About Us**
 We are the leader in human-centric cybersecurity. Half a million customers, including 87 of the Fortune 100, rely on Proofpoint to protect their organizations. We’re driven by a mission to stay ahead of bad actors and safeguard the digital world. Join us in our pursuit to defend data and protect people.
   

  

 How We Work
   

  

 At Proofpoint, you’ll be part of a global team that breaks barriers to redefine cybersecurity, guided by our BRAVE core values Bold in how we dream and innovate, Responsive to feedback, challenges, and opportunities, Accountable for results and best-in-class outcomes, Visionary in future-focused problem-solving, Exceptional in execution and impact.
   

  

**Company Overview**
 At Proofpoint, we have a passion for protecting people, data, and brands from today’s advanced threats and compliance risks. We hire the best people in the business to
   

  

* Build and enhance our proven human-centric security platform
* Blend innovation and speed in a constantly evolving cloud architecture
* Analyze new threats and offer deep insight through data-driven intel and artificial intelligence
* Collaborate with customers to help solve their toughest security challenges


 We are singularly devoted to helping our customers protect what matters most – their people and their data. That’s why we’re a leader in next-generation cybersecurity—and why 85% of the Fortune 100 trust us as a security partner.
   

  

  

  

**The Role** 
  

  

 Proofpoint is seeking an experienced and dynamic Sales Engineering (SE) Manager to develop a successful Enterprise franchise in partnership with the Regional Sales leader. You will lead and develop a team of talented sales engineers across Benelux & Nordics, with the key objectives of building pipeline, winning new and add-on business and developing happy customers on our Human-centric security platform. This individual will be a major contributor to our aggressive growth plans for the region and should ideally be located in Denmark or Sweden.
   

  

**Your day-to-day**
* Partner closely with the Regional Sales leader to build a strategy for growth and execute on it
* Accountability of all technical sales and satisfaction activities in the region, including formulating strategies to penetrate target accounts and expanding existing customers
* Highly engaged with customers, including evangelizing the Proofpoint vision at all levels, from technical to C-suite executives
* Attract, hire and retain top talent to support our rapid growth, including developing and mentoring team members to help them achieve their career goals, ideally here at Proofpoint
* Coach, enable, and develop a team of elite Sales Engineers in the key areas of Product and Technical Expertise, Owning the Technical Sales Process, Valued Solutions that Deliver Outcomes and behaving as a Trusted Advisor
* Foster a culture of continual learning, information sharing and collaboration amongst the team to keep all team members current on the latest innovations and build wisdom from recent customer engagements
* Actively collaborate with key internal stakeholders such as product, channel, customer success, marketing, services and support to build pipeline and ensure customer loyalty
* Engage and sponsor key local channel partners that support your business
* Encourage, initiate and execute local initiatives to grow the business
* The role is highly customer and partner facing and will require ~50% travel within the region


**What You Bring To The Team**
* Leadership & initiative – a motivated self-starter brimming with ideas, with the discipline and drive to execute on them to yield the desired outcomes
* A mature technically astute but business centric engineer with a proven ability to command a room, guide complex technical and business conversations with C-suite executives, as well as technical staff
* A commercially savvy technical sales leader who can partner effectively with sales leadership to develop and grow the business
* Proven experience of managing sales engineering teams, ideally in the cyber-security industry based on extensive previous experience as a sales engineer
* Track record of mentoring and developing team members and guiding them to success
* A strong collaborator with internal and external stakeholders, with a willingness to actively engage in discovering opportunities and problem solving at a technical level
* Ability to thrive in a fast paced, high energy sales environment
* Degree in Computer Science preferred or equivalent IT experience
* An excellent communicator and presenter with fluency in English and either Swedish, Danish or Dutch



**Why Proofpoint**
 Protecting people is at the heart of our award-winning cybersecurity solutions, and the people who work here are the key to our success.  We’re a customer-focused and driven-to-win organisation with leading-edge products. We are an inclusive, diverse, multinational company that believes in culture fit, but more importantly ‘culture-add’, and we strongly encourage people from all walks of life to apply.
   

  

  

  

 We believe in hiring the best and the brightest to help cultivate our culture of collaboration and appreciation. Apply today and explore your future at Proofpoint!
   

  

 Why Proofpoint? At Proofpoint, we believe that an exceptional career experience includes a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. Here are just a few reasons you’ll love working with us
   

  

* Competitive compensation
* Comprehensive benefits
* Learning & Development We are committed to the growth and development of our team members, offering a range of programs including leadership and professional development workshops, stretch project assignments, and mentoring opportunities to help employees reach their full potential.
* Flexible work environment [Remote options, hybrid schedules, flexible hours, etc.].
* Annual wellness and community outreach days
* Always on recognition for your contributions
* Global collaboration and networking opportunities


 Our Culture
   

  

 Our culture is rooted in values that inspire belonging, empower purpose and drive success-every day, for everyone. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please reach out to accessibility@proofpoint.com. How to Apply Interested? Submit your application here https //www.proofpoint.com/us/company/careers. We can’t wait to hear from you!

title: 2026 Commercial & Investment Bank - Global Corporate Banking Analyst Program - (Large-Cap)-Off-Cycle Internship - (January-June) - Stockholm
description:
**Job Description**
 With operations in 100 countries, JPMorgan Chase is a true global leader in the financial services industry. We believe the true measure of our success lies in the trusted relationships we share with our clients, our reputation in the industry, and the quality and integrity of the services we provide. In every area of our work, we're committed to being the best, and doing what's right for our clients. And it's that unshakeable commitment shared by everyone at JPMorgan Chase which makes this such a rewarding place to build a career.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 As a
 **2026 Corporate & Investment Bank - Global Corporate Banking Program - Off-Cycle Internship (Large-Cap) (January-June) – Stockholm** 
 within JPMorgan Chase, our team members and mentors will help you navigate the firm and continue to learn about our businesses. You will have access to senior management and a strong network of peers will promote ongoing professional development throughout the internship. Top performing interns may receive a full-time offer to join the two-year Global Corporate Banking analyst program.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Assisting GCB bankers in managing internal aspects of existing client relationships
* Helping with industry and credit analysis, including reviewing financial statements, supporting the credit approval and documentation process
* Gaining exposure to product, strategy, or client coverage-based teams
* Preparing internal memos, for example senior management briefings, decision committee memoranda
* Participating in the analysis and negotiation of financing requests in coordination with credit, product, legal and compliance teams
* Coordinating with product and country teams to identify and execute transactions for clients globally across a range of products, for example capital markets, risk solutions, transaction banking
* Networking with industry leaders, accessing best-in-class training and learning how all our businesses work together to provide excellent customer service


**Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills.**
* Exceptional analytical, research and project management skills
* Familiarity with business fundamentals
* Ability to quickly solve problems on your own and with a team
* Enthusiasm, energy and a drive to succeed
* A collaborative mindset and willingness to partner and work on a team
* The confidence and initiative to take on early responsibility and manage your own projects
* Proficiency in MS Word and Excel
* Fluency in English and either Danish, Finnish, Norwegian or Swedish
* Expected graduation date between January 2026 and December 2027


**Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities And Skills**
* Being on-track for a United Kingdom 2:1 Bachelor’s degree (or top grade equivalent) in your undergraduate studies is preferred.


 But beyond that, what we’re most interested in are the things that make you, you: the personal qualities, outside interests and achievements beyond academia that demonstrate the kind of person you are and the difference you could bring to the team.
   

  

**Application deadline: 31st October 2025**
*We will be filling our classes on a rolling basis. We strongly encourage you to submit your application as early as possible before job postings close.*
**Join us**
 At JPMorgan Chase, we’re creating positive change for the diverse communities we serve. We do this by championing your innovative ideas through a supportive culture that helps you every step of the way as you build your career. If you’re passionate, curious and ready to make an impact, we’re looking for you.
   

  

**What’s next?**
 Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume. Your application and resume is a way for us to initially get to know you, so it’s important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.
   

  

 After you confirm your application, we will review it to determine whether you meet certain required qualifications.
   

  

 You will then receive an email invitation to complete a video interview, powered by HireVue. This is your opportunity to further bring your resume to life and showcase your experience for our recruiting team and hiring managers.
   

  

 HireVue is required, and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed this. We strongly encourage that you apply and complete this as soon as possible, since programs will close as positions are filled.
   

  

 JPMorgan Chase is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that respects all people for their unique skills, backgrounds and professional experiences. We strive to hire qualified, diverse candidates, and we will provide reasonable accommodations for known disabilities.
   

  

 Visit jpmorganchase.com/careers for upcoming events, career advice, our locations and more.
   

  

**About Us**
 J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world’s most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.
   

  

 We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. We also make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs. Visit our FAQs for more information about requesting an accommodation.

title: Retail Marketing Coordinator
description:
**MARKNADSKOORDINATOR MED DOKUMENTERAD RETAIL-ERFARENHET**
 Hos oss på
 **Twilfit by** 
**CHANGE Lingerie** 
 får du inte bara ett jobb – du får möjlighet att bli en nyckelperson i att lyfta vårt varumärke och skapa inspirerande butiksmiljöer som stärker kundupplevelsen varje dag.
   

  

 Vi söker en
 **strukturerad, kommersiell och kreativ Marknadskoordinator** 
 med dokumenterad erfarenhet från retail – gärna med fokus på
 **visual merchandising och kampanjimplementering** 
 . Du brinner för att omsätta strategi till säljdrivande butikskommunikation och älskar att arbeta nära butikerna för att skapa synlighet, känsla och resultat.
   

  

**OM ROLLEN**
 Som
 **Marknadskoordinator** 
 spelar du en central roll i att säkerställa att CHANGE:s globala marknadsstrategi får liv lokalt – i butik, i digitala kanaler och i kundupplevelsen.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för att kampanjer, butiksmaterial och visuella uttryck håller hög kvalitet och speglar vårt varumärke på ett inspirerande och enhetligt sätt. Rollen kräver både kreativitet, struktur och ett starkt öga för detaljer – samt ett genuint intresse för hur kundresan ser ut i butik.
   

  

 Du samarbetar tätt med butikschefer, regionchefer, det nordiska marknadsteamet och våra internationella kollegor.
   

  

**DINA HUVUDSAKLIGA ANSVARSOMRÅDEN**
* Kampanjimplementering: Planera, anpassa och implementera globala kampanjer på den svenska marknaden. Följa upp resultat via trafik, försäljning och KPI:er.
* Visual Merchandising & butikssupport: Säkerställa att butikerna följer VM-riktlinjer, har rätt material och levererar en stark varumärkesupplevelse.
* Utbildning & onboarding: Introducera och utbilda butikspersonal i marknadsrelaterade processer, material och varumärkesstandarder.
* Kommunikation & PR: Samordna lokal PR, event och samarbeten med medier, influencers och köpcentrum.
* Club CHANGE: Implementera och vidareutveckla vårt lojalitetsprogram i linje med den globala strategin.
* KPI-uppföljning & analys: Följa upp nyckeltal och dela insikter med region- och marknadsteam för kontinuerlig förbättring.
* Projektledning: Driva och koordinera lokala initiativ såsom nyöppningar, butiksevents och säsongslanseringar.


**VI SÖKER DIG SOM**
* Har minst 2–4 års dokumenterad erfarenhet från retail, med praktisk erfarenhet av visual merchandising, kampanjer och butikskommunikation.
* Förstår hur man skapar kommersiellt genomslag i butik genom visuella uttryck, säljdrivande kampanjer och engagerande storytelling.
* Är strukturerad, självgående och ansvarstagande – men trivs bäst i ett team där alla vinner tillsammans.
* Har mycket god kommunikativ förmåga på både svenska och engelska.
* Har starka IT-kunskaper och gärna erfarenhet av analysverktyg som Power BI.
* Är positiv, lösningsorienterad och flexibel – och delar våra värderingar One Team, Ambitious, Customer-Oriented.


**VI ERBJUDER**
* En dynamisk och inspirerande arbetsmiljö med engagerade kollegor och stark laganda.
* Ett nära samarbete med våra butiker och möjlighet att påverka både vår lokala närvaro och vårt globala uttryck.
* Utrymme för kreativitet, ansvar och egna initiativ.
* En vardag präglad av energi, utveckling och passion för kundupplevelse.


 ✨
 **Vill du vara med och skapa visuellt starka butiksupplevelser och driva CHANGE:s varumärke framåt?**
 Välkommen med din ansökan! Urval sker löpande – skicka in din ansökan redan idag.

title: SAP S/4HANA Consultant -- Sweden
description:
**Job Description**
**Role** 
 - Principal Consultant
   

  

**Technology** 
 – SAP S/4HANA
   

  

**Location** 
 – Sweden
   

  

**Compensation** 
 – Competitive (including bonus)
   

  

**Job Description**
 Today, the corporate landscape is dynamic and the world ahead is full of possibilities! None of the amazing things we do at Infosys would be possible without an equally amazing culture, the environment where ideas can flourish and where you are empowered to move forward as far as your ideas will take you.
   

  

 At Infosys, we assure that your career will never stand still, we will inspire you to build what’s next and we will navigate further together. Our journey of learnability, values and trusted relationships with our clients continue to be the cornerstones of our organization and these values are upheld only because of our people.
   

  

**Your role**
 Infosys is seeking a highly experienced and dynamic Principal Consultant – SAP to join our growing SAP practice. This role demands deep expertise in SAP technologies, strong leadership capabilities, and a proven track record of delivering complex transformation programs. As a Principal Consultant, you will lead solution architecture, client engagements, and delivery excellence across SAP S/4HANA projects.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead SAP solutions across multiple end-to-end implementations and transformation programs.
* Drive client engagements from Phase 0 through execution, including Greenfield, Brownfield, and Hybrid S/4HANA projects.
* Collaborate with client stakeholders (Business and IT) to define roadmaps, assess readiness, and build transformation strategies.
* Utilize SAP toolchain for implementation, administration, and optimization.
* Prepare solution proposals, effort estimations, and contribute to RFP responses.
* Mentor and manage project teams, ensuring delivery quality and adherence to timelines.
* Represent Infosys in client meetings with professionalism and strong interpersonal communication.
* Stay current with SAP innovations and contribute to internal knowledge sharing.


**Skill Required**
* Deep functional (SAP Finance/Manufacturing/Logistics/Sales) or technical skills (ABAP, Integration, Security, Basis) in one or two SAP ERP skills.
* Experience in SAP S/4HANA, EWM, TM, Business AI, LeanIX, Signavio, Cloud ALM
* Hands-on SAP consulting experience.
* Minimum of 4 full lifecycle SAP project implementations.
* Experience in leading teams in SAP projects.
* Exposure to at least two types of S/4HANA projects: Greenfield, Brownfield, or Hybrid.
* Experience in transformation preparation or Phase 0 activities.
* Proficiency in SAP toolchain usage or administration.
* Valid SAP certification in relevant skill areas.
* Strong client-facing skills with the ability to engage middle management effectively.
* Proven ability to build solution proposals and estimate efforts accurately.
* Demonstrated flexibility, team spirit, and a results-driven mindset.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Exposure to multiple SAP modules or skill areas within the SAP product portfolio.
* Publications or thought leadership in SAP or industry-specific domains.


**About Infosys**
 Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 56 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through the many next of their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
   

  

 Visit www.infosys.com to see how Infosys can help your enterprise navigate your next.
   

  

**All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit, competence and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Infosys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer**

title: Erfaren Enterprise Architect med affärssinne? Vi söker dig!
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vill du vara med och forma framtidens industriella landskap? Vi söker en vass och självgående Enterprise Architecture-rådgivare med ett strategiskt mindset och passion för att skapa verklig affärsnytta i komplexa organisationer. Hos oss får du arbeta med några av Sveriges mest välkända industribolag – i uppdrag där du gör skillnad på riktigt, tillsammans med andra seniora specialister.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som Enterprise Architect hos oss får du en nyckelroll i att driva och förankra arkitektur- och transformationsinitiativ. Vanliga uppgifter inkluderar:
   

  

* Ta fram och förankra EA-roadmaps och målbilder
* Rådgivning kring styrning, investeringar och förändringsinitiativ
* Bedömning och design av applikations- och informationslandskap
* Leda EA-forum och stötta beslutsfattare i strategiska teknikval
* Bygga broar mellan IT och verksamhet i transformationsresor


 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Minst 10 års erfarenhet inom IT- eller verksamhetsarkitektur, strategi eller närliggande områden
* Konsulterfarenhet och vana att arbeta nära beslutsfattare
* Förmåga att kommunicera komplexa idéer på ett tydligt och affärsnära sätt
* Kommersiellt mindset och förmåga att bygga långsiktiga relationer


 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet från tillverknings- eller byggindustrin
* Kunskap inom ett eller flera av följande områden: Industriell digitalisering / smart industri (Industry 4.0) Produktlivscykelhantering (PLM) & digitala tvillingar Informationsmodellering & datastyrning (data governance) Hållbarhetsrapportering och ESG-drivna IT-initiativ Modernisering av legacy / ERP-landskap i molnmiljöer


 Viktiga kompetenser och egenskaper:
   

  

* Strategisk och analytisk förmåga – du ser helheten och kopplar IT till affärsmål
* Arkitekturkompetens – du behärskar modellering, design och styrning
* Kommunikationsförmåga – du bygger förtroende och leder dialoger med ledning
* Förändringsledning – du har erfarenhet av att driva transformationer
* Teknisk bredd – du har koll på moderna teknologier, molnplattformar och integration


 Meriterande certifieringar är:
   

  

* TOGAF®, ArchiMate®
* Certified Business Architect (CBA®)
* SAFe® Architect / Agilist, ICP-ENT
* AWS / Azure / Google Cloud Architect
* CDMP, COBIT®


 Vad vi erbjuder:
   

  

* Möjlighet att påverka Sveriges mest spännande industriprojekt
* Kollegor som är lika kunniga som de är prestigelösa
* Flexibla arbetsformer och fokus på balans i livet
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling och kunskapsdelning


 Några av våra förmåner är bland annat
   

  

* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4000 kr.
* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Trygg anställning: Våra konsulter anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.


 Låter det intressant?
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att höra ifrån dig! Skicka in din ansökan redan idag då urvalet sker löpande. Har du frågor om rollen, kontakta gärna Azra Dajic på azra.dajic@cgi.com. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Sales Engineer (Water Industry)
description:
**Are you interested in…** 




  




* Working for a market-leading, global water quality technology company that’s dedicated to sustainability?
* A dynamic B2B field-sales account management role visiting industrial and municipal customers to sell value-based solutions?
* A professional, structured sales environment with relevant training, support and career development opportunities?



  





**If so, read on!** 




  





 At Hach, we ensure water quality for billions of people around the world. Protecting water, the most valuable resource, and driving sustainability are very close to our hearts. You will be part of a flexible, family-friendly organization that cares about its people just as it cares about the environment.
 



  





 Based at home (most ideally in Stockholm, but we’ll also consider Norrköping, Linköping, Eskiltuna, Jönköping, Orebro etc) and travelling extensively across the Stockholm South territory, the Sales Engineer visits a broad range of industrial and municipal organizations with a mix of existing customers and new targets to identify needs and propose the right water quality measurement solutions.
 



  





 The water industry in Sweden is growing in the coming years and Hach needs talent who are enthusiastic about being part of our growth journey. This richly varied sales role encompasses account plan development, lead generation, mapping decision-makers, product demonstrations, trade shows, and the execution of the entire sales cycle to the highest professional standards. If you’ve ever wondered what you’re truly capable of, there’s no better place to find out!
 



  





**The Ideal Candidate:** 




  




* ‘New business hunting’ Sales Engineer / Account Manager, ideally with B2B industrial exposure (food & beverages, pharmaceuticals, paper, chemicals, waste water etc)
* Strong commercial awareness. Exposure to the water industry and measurement technology products would be advantageous
* Ability to work independently and proactively
* Fluent Swedish and advanced English language skills. A consultative approach to uncover and solve customer’s needs
* Excellent sales CRM administration, forecasting and reporting, using Salesforce etc
* A valid driver’s licence and able to drive extensively across a large sales territory, with some occasional overnight stays away from home



  





**About Hach** 




  





 Motivated by the highest possible stakes of climate change and global health, we’re working together within a rapidly digitizing industry to find innovative technologies that guarantee the safety of our water and our environment. More about us: https://www.hach.com/about-us
 



  





 Hach is proud to part of the Water Quality segment of Veralto (www.veralto.com | NYSE: VLTO), a $5B global leader dedicated to ensuring access to clean water, safe food and medicine, and trusted essential goods.
 



  





 When you join Veralto’s vibrant global network of 16,000 associates, you join a unique culture and work e
 *nvironment where purpose meets* 
 possibility: where the work you do has an everyday impact on the resources and essentials we all rely on, and where you’ll have valuable opportunities to deepen your skillset, pursue your ambitions, and grow your career. Together, we’re Safeguarding the World’s Most Vital Resources™—and building rewarding careers along the way.

title: Life Science är din arena – vi söker dig!
description:
Här handlar det om vad som händer när läkemedel ska produceras, när produktionen förändras och processerna säkras. Detta sker oftast via investeringsprojekt och på Rejlers Life Science söker vi dig som vill vara med och forma den verkligheten med expertis, nyfikenhet och mod.
   

  

 Vi har inte flest konsulter. Men vi har några av branschens skarpaste. Vill du bli en av oss?
   

  

**About The Job**
 Hos oss får du ta plats som rådgivare och inte bara som utförare. Vi söker
 **seniora konsulter** 
 som vill vara med och utveckla Life Science i nära samarbete med våra kunder.
   

  

 Vad som är gemensamt för alla roller? Du kan GMP. Det är grundplattan oavsett disciplin.
   

  

**Vi letar efter kompetens inom:**
**Projektledning**
 Seniora projektledare och tekniska projektledare med erfarenhet av investeringsprojekt inom Life Science, erfarenhet av GMP och van att driva projekt i komplexa produktionsmiljöer.
   

  

**Kommissionering,
 **kvalificering** 
 & validering**
 Specialister på FAT/SAT, Kvalificering/ validering av utrustning, renrum, medier och datoriserade system. Du kan hantera helheten – från krav till godkänd installation och funktion.
   

  

**Produktion & process**
 Erfarna produktions- och processingenjörer med bakgrund inom läkemedel, processutveckling och etablering av nya produktionslinjer – både green field och brown field.
   

  

**QA & QA IT**
 Kvalitetssäkrare som kan GMP inifrån och ut inom både traditionella och digitala systemmiljöer.
   

  

**OT/IT & digitalisering**
 Automation, digitala produktionslösningar och Pharma 4.0. Vi söker dig som vill ligga längst fram i utvecklingen.
   

  

**SME / Lead Engineers**
 Spetskompetens inom valfritt område – du är den man ringer in när det måste bli rätt från början.
   

  

 Vi välkomnar både dig som trivs i linjeroller och dig som axlar rådgivande expertuppdrag i projektform.
   

  

 WHO ARE YOU?
   

  

 Att vara en del av vårt team på Rejlers innebär att du inte bara tar del av en spännande arbetsmiljö utan även en plattform där din erfarenhet och kompetens kan blomstra till sin fulla potential. Vi söker individer som inte bara är
 **självgående** 
 och
 **erfarna** 
 inom Life Science-branschen, utan som också är drivna av
 **nyfikenhet** 
 och som har en vilja att
 **utvecklas både personligt och professionellt.**
 Du har djup förståelse för Life Science-industrin och
 **minst 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta i GMP produktionsstyrda miljöer** 
 . Du är trygg i din kompetens, lösningsorienterad och van att arbeta nära kund. Det är
 **starkt meriterande** 
 om du sedan tidigare arbetat som konsult.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som kombinerar struktur med nyfikenhet och som har mod att utmana men också förmåga att lyssna.
   

  

 ◻ Kunskaper i både svenska och engelska är ett krav för att säkerställa effektiv kommunikation och samarbete inom nätverket av kunder och kollegor.
   

  

**What You Get**
 På Rejlers blir du en del av en
 **öppen** 
 och
 **välkomnande** 
 atmosfär där vi värnar om våra medarbetare och strävar efter att skapa en arbetsmiljö där du
 **trivs** 
 och
 **utvecklas** 
 . Vi är ett team som är öppna för nya perspektiv och välkomnar komplexa utmaningar. Hos oss får du möjlighet att vara med och påverka vår fortsatta resa i en framtidsinriktad verksamhet med
 **högt i tak** 
 och
 **frihet** 
 under ansvar. Vill du läsa mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss så klicka dig in här.
   

  

 Vi på Rejlers erbjuder vi kvalificerade tjänster inom en rad olika sektorer, inklusive energi, infrastruktur, byggnad, industri och också såklart inom Life Science. Vår resa har bara börjat och möjligheterna till tillväxt hos oss är stora.
   

  

**Vill du vara en del av framtiden för svensk Life Science?
   

  

 Välkommen till Rejlers – vi är redo när du är det.**
 💙
   

  

*Som ett kvalitativt led i våra rekryteringsprocesser kommer en bakgrundskontroll genomföras på slutkandidaten. Som en del av bakgrundskontrollen kommer vi även att be dig visa upp ett utdrag från belastningsregistret.*
*Vissa roller kräver även annan kontroll, såsom t.ex. säkerhetsprövning, innan uppdrag hos vissa kunder - om det är aktuellt för tjänsten du sökt så kommer du att få mer information kring det i ett senare skede. Ytterligare information hittar du även här:* 
  

  

 Behandling av personuppgifter | Rejlers
   

  

*Vi granskar ansökningar löpande och tjänsten kan komma att bli tillsatt innan sista ansökningsdag.*

title: Thesis Internship – Legal @ Signup Software (Spring 2026)
description:
Are you ready to take your law studies to the next level and explore what it’s like to work in tech? As a thesis intern at Signup Software, you’ll get a front-row seat to how law and innovation intersect in a fast-growing, international software company.
   

  

 During approximately 10 weeks, you’ll work closely with our Head of Legal and gain hands-on experience in areas such as commercial contracts, data protection, compliance, IP, and corporate law. You’ll be part of a collaborative team where ideas are welcomed, curiosity is encouraged, and learning is constant.
   

  

**Why Signup Software?**
 Signup Software is a Swedish software company with a global footprint. Our innovative solutions help organizations worldwide automate and optimize their financial processes. We combine innovation with stability and are driven by the belief that great tech is built by great people.
   

  

 As a legal intern, you’ll gain valuable insight into how the legal function supports growth, manages risk, and enables innovation in an international tech company. You will also be able to discuss ideas regarding your thesis with our Head of Legal, that will function as a mentor during the internship.
   

  

**Who are we looking for?**
**You Are Someone Who**
* Studies law and will write your thesis during Spring 2026
* Is curious about how legal work operates in the tech industry
* Has strong academic results and a genuine interest in commercial law, IT law, and corporate law
* Thrives in a dynamic environment and enjoys collaborating with others


**Application**
 Apply no later than
 **November 30, 2025** 
 , by answering a few questions and attaching your
 **CV** 
 and academic transcripts.
   

  

 Applications are reviewed on a rolling basis, so don’t wait too long to apply.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you—and to giving you a real-world experience of what it’s like to work with Legal in Tech.
   

  

**Who** 
**are SignUp?**
 At SignUp Software, we’re not just developing software—we’re transforming how finance teams work. Founded in Sweden and now a global leader in financial process automation, our award-winning solution ExFlow is trusted by over 1,200 customers in more than 60 countries.
   

  

 Built natively into Microsoft Dynamics 365, ExFlow empowers finance departments to streamline accounts payable, accounts receivable, and other critical workflows with speed, accuracy, and insight. We’re also expanding fast—across Europe, North America, APAC, and beyond—with the backing of leading private equity firm Insight Partners.
   

  

 SignUp Software was founded in 1999 and introduced ExFlow in 2003. Over the years, SignUp Software has earned a strong reputation in the Microsoft Dynamics community for its solutions in financial process automation. The solutions in the ExFlow product portfolio are built in Microsoft Dynamics 365 and utilize Azure Services, specifically designed for the “Office of the CFO”.

title: Senior Manager, Public Relations (Bangkok-based, Relocation Provided)
description:
**About Agoda**
 Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with a global network of 4.7M hotels and holiday properties worldwide, plus flights, activities, and more. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 7,100+ employees representing 95+ nationalities in 27 markets foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
   

  

**Our Purpose -** 
**Bridging the World Through Travel**
 We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.
   

  

 We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.
   

  

**Get to Know our Team:**
 The Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. The department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable channels. The team combines a blend of talents from the best analysts, marketing strategists, data scientists and brand specialists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and have built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.
   

  

**The Opportunity:**
 We are looking for an
 **Senior Manager, Global Public Relations (Consumer PR)** 
 to join our dynamic team within Agoda’s Marketing department. The global communications function is responsible for building and protecting Agoda’s reputation as a trusted and innovative brand with partners and consumer worldwide. Our Communications team oversees 10+ managed markets, supporting different parts of the business to help share Agoda’s story. The person who fills this Senior PR Manager role will be central to making us even more impactful as part of an international, results-focused Communications team. We move fast and leverage many channels to reach our audiences. You’ll be able to make a difference quickly, contributing ideas and helping to shape our thinking.
   

  

 The role will be
 **based in Bangkok** 
 , Thailand and will be reporting to the Director of Communications
   

  

**In this Role, you'll get to:**
* Shape and define the PR strategy to elevate Agoda’s visibility in markets across Asia Pacific and beyond
* Manage and develop two direct reports, providing regular feedback, coaching, and support to help them achieve their goals
* Manage multi market agency teams to deliver measurable consumer content
* Ideate scalable content to keep Agoda in the news leveraging a combination of data, product, campaign and corporate news
* Keeping a finger on the pulse of breaking news, spotting trends and other editorial/content opportunities for Agoda, what makes the news and how to create that narrative
* Problem solving to develop creative media relations strategies, while also being analytical and measurement driven
* Providing input for the Agoda global team drafting pitches, media briefings, Q&As as well as generating campaign ideas
* Responding to global media enquiries and maintaining the Agoda press office
* Managing and counselling stakeholders throughout Agoda who require PR support


**What you'll Need to Succeed:**
* Creative thinking and an all-round make-it-happen team attitude
* 8+ years of experience in public relations in traditional and digital teams,  advantageous, ideally in both an agency and in-house setting. Experience should include 3+ years managing teams or direct reports.
* Strong story-telling experience to consumer, corporate and B2B audiences
* Demonstrable experience of an integrated approach to PR (content, social media, influencers, media partnership etc.)
* Strong media contacts; sound knowledge of influencers and non-traditional channels
* Great English writing, editing and proof-reading skills.
* Crisis and issues management experience would be beneficial
* Quick thinking and ability to spot trends and exploit opportunities to respond quickly to social sentiment
* Project management capabilities and experience in managing creative and production resources
* Experience in working within a matrix organization structure, across multiple markets and influencing different internal and external stakeholders
* Experience of managing and optimizing budgets
* Ability to measure quality/impact of content for future improvement

* Agoda Careers https://careersatagoda.com

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.
   

  

 We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy.
