 We do not accept any terms or conditions, nor do we recognize any agency’s representation of a candidate, from unsolicited third-party or agency submissions. If we receive unsolicited or speculative CVs, we reserve the right to contact and hire the candidate directly without any obligation to pay a recruitment fee.

title: AI Founding Engineer
description:
Fluencify is an AI-powered platform helping brands scale authentic user-generated content through vetted student creators. We combine creativity, data, and automation to make influencer marketing scalable and authentic.
   





**Role** 




 We’re looking for a
 **Founding Engineer (AI / Software)** 
 to join as our first technical co-founder. You’ll take ownership of building and integrating our AI stack — powering content scoring, trend analysis, and automated workflows.
   





**What you'll do** 



* Develop and deploy AI features end-to-end
* Integrate machine learning models into the SaaS platform
* Work closely with the founders on product and data strategy



**Reqirements** 



* Strong skills in Python and modern AI frameworks
* Experience with NLP, computer vision, or trend prediction
* Entrepreneurial mindset and ability to ship fast in early-stage environments



**Why join** 



* Founding-level ownership and impact
* Hybrid work setup in Stockholm
* Build the AI core of a fast-growing creator tech startup

title: Student Opportunity (AI/Engineering)
description:
Want to get involved in applied AI that solves a validated, real-world headache for businesses? We're looking for engineering / machine learning students with curiosity to support us in making a leap forward in shaping the future of Brand Intelligence.
 



  





**What you bring:** 




  




* Currently enrolled in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Engineering, Applied Physics or a related field at a leading technology faculty in Sweden (preferably 3rd or 4th year).
* Solid foundational knowledge in AI / Machine Learning concepts.
* Desire to contribute to how AI technology can be pushed forward.
* Innovative, problem-solving mindset
* Passion for building stuff that create real value



  





**Details:** 




  




* **Duration:** 
 Flexible
* **Scope:** 
 Flexible
* **Start Date:** 
 Asap
* **Location:** 
 Stockholm (remote in Sweden accepted)



  





**About us:** 




  





 We are a technology startup on a mission to build the next generation of tools for enterprise branding. We believe that AI should be a collaborative partner, empowering brands to be more effective and consistent.
 



  





 For the right person, we expect that this can be a long term collaboration and could potentially lead to strong opportunities going forward.

title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We are looking for a skilled Senior Engineering Manager to lead our Observability team.
   

  

**Your Role within the Kingdom**
 As an Senior Engineering Manager in Runtime & Insights your responsibility is to lead and empower the Observability team, delivering tools and services that enhance the reliability and insights of our global operations. You are not only a manager but also a product visionary, guiding both the technical roadmap and product strategy to ensure exceptional user value.
   

  

 You'll lead a dedicated Observability team responsible for maintaining and advancing observability and reliability through robust logging, metrics, tracing, and profiling solutions. The products your team delivers will support developers and operational teams across King, ensuring optimal performance and health of our game platform.
   

  

 You’ll collaborate closely with engineering teams, influencing strategies around how we monitor all King games and services across our Public Cloud footprint, while championing best practices in DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 Lead, motivate and inspire a team of passionate engineers that own and operate the observability platform at King.
   

  

 Lead both technical strategy and product management within Observability, driving product vision and execution.
   

  

 Build and evolve solutions for observability leveraging Grafana (collector and dashboarding), Loki (logs), Mimir (metrics), and Pyroscope (profiling).
   

  

 Act as an ambassador for on-call practices, leveraging PagerDuty for incident management and promoting robust reliability engineering culture.
   

  

 Drive adoption and best practices for Site Reliability Engineering.
   

  

 Collaborate effectively across King to understand business needs and align technical deliverables.
   

  

 Foster a supportive, inclusive team environment that nurtures career growth and team cohesion.
   

  

 Skills to Create Thrills
   

  

 7+ years leading and motivating high performing engineering teams.
   

  

 Deep expertise in cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
   

  

 Strong understanding of observability tools and concepts, including metrics, logs, traces, and profiling.
   

  

 Practical experience with Grafana, Loki, Mimir, Pyroscope, and PagerDuty.
   

  

 Solid experience managing technical teams, driving product roadmaps, and managing stakeholder expectations.
   

  

 Proven leadership in creating a healthy engineering culture emphasizing collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement.
   

  

 Excellent strategic thinking, capable of independently contributing to King’s broader technology and product strategies.
   

  

**Healthy Team**
 Ability to build and maintain a structured, high-performing team with clearly defined roles aligned with strategic priorities.
   

  

 Demonstrated success in mentoring team members, fostering communication, and embedding a collaborative and service-oriented mindset.
   

  

**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Platform Engineer till Accelerate at Iver
description:
Är du redo att forma framtidens IT tillsammans med några av branschens vassaste konsulter? Accelerate at Iver växer – och vi söker fler Platform Engineers som vill vara med och bygga smarta, hållbara och säkra lösningar i teknikens absoluta framkant.
   

  

****💼** 
**Din roll****
 Som en del av vårt DevOps-team får du arbeta med marknadsledande kunder och hjälpa dem genom deras digitala transformation. Du jobbar långsiktigt i teamleveranser med modernisering, automation och agil utveckling – enligt vår metodik
 *Journey* 
 to Agile. Några av de tekniker/metoder som vi arbetar med är Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, Jenkins, Ansible, Git, Bash, Python.
   

  

******✅** 
 Vem är du?****
 Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet inom Plattform/DevOps och som brinner för automatisering och att bygga effektiva lösningar ute hos våra kunder. Du uttrycker dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
   

  

 För denna position krävs svenskt medborgarskap, vi utför även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.
   

  

**🛠️ Du Bör Ha Koll På**
* Linux i enterprise-miljöer
* Containerteknik: Docker, Kubernetes
* Script/programmering: Bash, Python, Go
* Versionshantering: Git
* Automatisering: Ansible, Terraform
* CI/CD och GitOps


**Extra Plus Om Du Även Har Koll På**
* OpenStack
* Public cloud
* OpenShift/Rancher
* HashiCorp Vault/Consul


****🌱** 
**Vi** 
 erbjuder dig**
 Som anställd på Accelerate at Iver erbjuder vi förutom spännande uppdrag och tekniker:
   

  

* Utbildning & certifieringar via våra partners (Red Hat, HashiCorp, GitLab m.fl.)
* En trygg och säker anställning med bra förmåner
* Kollektivavtal, friskvårdsbidrag och sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Flexibilitet, frihet och balans mellan jobb och fritid
* Att bli en del i ett passionerat team med tekniskt vassa kollegor


 Vi tror på gemenskap och kompetensutbyte – här utvecklas vi tillsammans och stöttar varandra för att alltid ligga i framkant.
   

  

**📍Placeringsort**
 Accelerate at Iver finns på flertal orter i Sverige och Norge. För denna tjänst utgår du från vårt kontor i Stockholm, med möjlighet till hybridarbete.
   

  

**Vi intervjuar löpande – vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan!**
 👉 Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Har du frågor? Kontakta Jesper Carlsson på jesper.carlsson@iver.se
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot att träffa dig. Välkommen til** 
**l Accelerate at Iver!** 
 🚀

title: AI Engineer
description:
**Filed is building the first AI tax preparer trusted by America’s accounting firms.**


This industry might seem boring,but it’s a $70B backbone of the economy that’s breaking under a talent shortage no one has solved. We’re fixing it. Fast.


In just 9 months, we’ve hit strong product-market fit, are generating insanely fast-growing, ridiculously sticky revenue, and are backed by top-tier investors. We’re not a tool—we’re the missing workforce firms have been sounding the alarm for. We’re building the future by expanding our already 30-person team with those who want to say “I was there when it all started.”


Read more TechCrunch


⸻

 **What we should tell you about the role**  

This role sits at the heart of how we turn complex, human tax reasoning into scalable intelligence. You’ll be building the brain of the first AI tax preparer trusted by America’s accounting firms. Your work will touch everything from retrieval pipelines to model evaluation to how our system thinks about a single user query. This is not a narrow research role—it’s applied, fast-moving, and deeply interdisciplinary. You’ll partner with product, engineering, and domain experts to ship features that real firms rely on daily, balancing cutting-edge AI with the rigor and reliability that compliance demands.

**Here’s why this is a terrible job**


This isn’t for someone who likes to move slow. We operate week to week with ruthless speed. Sometimes we’re wrong, but more often we’re right—and we course-correct fast. If you need extra days to perfect your model, teammates will be waiting on you. We use tools like Cursor, OpenAI, and Gemini to prototype fast, test in prod, and push to users in hours, not quarters. You’ll work at the intersection of LLMs, user behavior, compliance, and knowledge graphs, with no clean datasets or perfect answers—just judgment calls and chaos. You’ll ask yourself, *is this really the work?* It is. And it’s not for everyone.

**... and here’s why it’s the best career choice you’ll make**

We’re hyperscaling, well-funded, and hit strong product-market fit in nine months. We’re building what tax pros call impossible, a product that behaves like a teammate, not a tool. We run reviews every four months, operate with full transparency, and pay above market with fast-growing equity. You’ll own decisions, ship because you believe in what you build, and talk to users weekly. We’ll set the goal; how you get there;prompting, tuning, retrieval, structured data—is up to you. You’ll help build a customer oracle so sharp it predicts what users need before they do.

 **What you’ll be responsible for**  

You’ll design and implement LLM-powered workflows across tax, finance, and compliance, building agentic frameworks with tools like adk, LangChain, and CrewAI. You’ll develop scalable knowledge systems for memory, retrieval, and reasoning, and own prompt pipelines, vector stores, fine-tuned models, and evals. You’ll think in systems, probabilities, and second-order effects as you work across ambiguous problem spaces that blend LLMs, APIs, and semi-structured data. You’ll become an internal Oracle, building a deep mental model of our users so precise it can predict what they need before they ask.

**The teammate we’re looking for**  

You thrive on complexity and get energized by the edge cases most people avoid. You’re pragmatic—fast to ship, faster to learn—and you believe research only matters when it drives outcomes. You’re fluent in tools like OpenAI, Gemini, and Claude, comfortable writing production-grade Python, and confident working across cloud environments like GCP or Azure. You grasp embeddings, RAG, and retrieval at scale, and may have built internal tooling for model debugging or evals. You collaborate deeply across product, engineering, and operations, stay curious about everything you automate, and take full ownership of outcomes. You love seeing your work in front of real users daily—and improving it just as quickly.

**Growth and Levels:**

* We operate on six levels, from Level 1 to Level 6. Each reflects increasing ownership, impact, and scope with meaningful jumps in salary and equity.
* We review levels every 4 months. Promotions are based on output and ownership, not tenure.
* This isn’t a comfy lean-back role. It’s fast, focused, and customer-obsessed.
* You will launch fast. You will learn fast. You will own what you ship.

**Equal Opportunity**


Filed is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If you’re excited about this role but don’t meet every single qualification, we encourage you to apply anyway as we’re building a team of people with diverse strengths, experiences, and backgrounds.

title: Developers to Tele2 - Build the Future of Telecom with Us
description:
*Do you want to shape real digital experiences that impact millions of people? Thrive in an environment with freedom, purpose, and fun? At TELE2, we’re building smarter, easier and more sustainable tech – and we want you to join the journey.*
**About The Role**
 TELE2’s IT organization is evolving rapidly as we build the next generation of digital experiences. As the telecom industry makes bold shifts, we’re determined to lead the way. To support our growth, we’re looking for passionate developers across multiple areas to join our product teams.
   

  

 You’ll be part of an autonomous team, working in a cross-functional setup with designers, product managers, and analysts. Together, you own your product – from architecture and development to deployment and operations.
   

  

 We build cloud-native services in Kubernetes and work in microservice-based architectures. We value simplicity, automation, and quality – and we’re serious about owning what we build.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For**
 We’re hiring developers across different roles and backgrounds. You might be a great fit if you identify with one or more of the following:
   

  

* Backend Developer: Experience with Go, Java, .NET, Spring Boot, or Kafka
* Frontend Developer: Skilled in JavaScript, Vue or similar frameworks
* Platform / DevOps Engineer: Comfortable with Linux, Kubernetes, GitLab and cloud infrastructure (especially Azure)


 You don’t need to tick every box – we value curiosity, problem-solving skills, and the drive to learn.

title: Data Architect
description:
**Att jobba som data architect**
 Som data architect kommer du tillhöra vårt Data & Analytics team som är organiserat inom Finance för att stötta hela Skandias verksamhet. Teamet består av arkitekter, systemutvecklare och verksamhetsutvecklare som alla sitter på vårt huvudkontor i Stockholm. Vi är med och bidrar till Skandias digitaliseringsresa genom att etablera ett nytt informationsförsörjningssystem och förbättrade analyticsförmågor. Vi säkerställer att rätt data finns tillgänglig på ett effektivt och säkert sätt.
   

  

 Du kommer ha det övergripande ansvaret för att designa dataarkitekturen för våra dataflöden, modeller, lagringsmönster och integrationer. Likväl säkerställer du att vi följer våra regelverk (t.ex. GDPR) och långsiktiga värde mot affären. Rollen innebär nära dialog med lösningsarkitekter inom området, utvecklingsteam på IT sidan samt andra verksamhets­utvecklare inom Skandias verksamhet. Du kommunicerar regelbundet med ledningsgrupper och seniora chefer inom Skandia, vilket gör din roll både affärsnära och strategisk. Hos Skandia får du vara med på en spännande förändringsresa och jobba i en organisation som jobbar agilt och som värdesätter hållbara lösningar.
   

  

 Vi arbetar hybrid, vilket innebär arbete på kontoret varvat med distansarbete. I rollen kommer du att rapportera till chefen för Data & Analytics.
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen**
 Som person är du driven, tålmodig och gillar att leda i förändring. Du kan bygga starka relationer med andra intressenter både internt och externt genom att kunna kommunicera enkelt med både IT- och affärssidan.
   

  

 För att lyckas ser vi att du har mångårig erfarenhet som data architect eller liknande roller. Du har kunskap om dataarkitekturprinciper och förmåga att utforma en effektiv och skalbar datastruktur. Datamodelleringsprinciper inklusive Data Vault är något som du har kännedom om. Du kan ETL-processer och verktyg för att integrera och transformera data från olika källor. Erfarenhet av molnbaserade plattformar och data-hanterings¬ramverk som Azure, Snowflake, Hadoop eller motsvarande gör att du kan navigera i våran tekniska miljö. Slutligen är du bekant och kan arbetat med agila ramverk och metoder. Ett grundkrav i rollen är att du kan flytande svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Meriterande är om du har en relevant högskoleutbildning eller har jobbat inom bank-, finans- eller försäkringsområdet.
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Vi jobbar med löpande urval så tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan redan idag. I ansökan kommer vi att ställa ett antal urvalsfrågor som ligger till grund för första urvalet. För att göra rekryteringsprocessen så rättvis och objektiv som möjligt kommer det att ingå intervjuer, tester, bakgrundskontroll samt digital referenstagning.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kring rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Hellen Malmberg på hellen.malmberg@skandia.se.
   

  

 Om du har frågor kopplat till rekryteringsprocess, vänligen ta kontakt med Harald Brehmer Talent Acquistion Partner på harald.brehmer@skandia.se.
   

  

 Vi kommer att återkoppla till alla som söker oavsett om du går vidare eller inte.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Mer om Finance**
 Inom Finance arbetar vi
 *framåt tillsammans* 
 för att vara en affärsnära partner och skapa långsiktigt värde för Skandia. Totalt sett består vi av fem olika avdelningar med ungefär 120 medarbetare som alla sitter i Stockholm på Lindhagensgatan 86.
   

  

 Våra avdelningar inom Finance är: Finance Transformation & Infomation , Accounting & Reporting, Aktuarie & Modellering, Inköp & Support samt Group Planning & Control.
   

  

 Tillsammans strävar vi efter att skapa ett effektivt och värdeskapande Finance. Vi arbetar proaktivt för att säkerställa effektiva kärnprocesser genom att följa externa och interna krav. Vårt huvuduppdrag är att stödja koncernledningen med analyser och strategiska beslutsunderlag samt övriga verksamhetsområden inom koncernen. Vi stödjer även våra funktioner med finansiell analys och rapportering. Vårt gemensamma arbete ska hålla hög kvalitet och skapa värde för Skandia. Tillsammans optimerar vi financeområdet genom nya teknologier, arbetssätt och kompetenser. Detta åstadkommer vi genom gott ledarskap, samarbete och engagemang.

title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
 We are looking for a skilled Senior Engineering Manager to lead our Observability team.
   

  

**Your Role within the Kingdom**
 As an Senior Engineering Manager in Runtime & Insights your responsibility is to lead and empower the Observability team, delivering tools and services that enhance the reliability and insights of our global operations. You are not only a manager but also a product visionary, guiding both the technical roadmap and product strategy to ensure exceptional user value.
   

  

 You'll lead a dedicated Observability team responsible for maintaining and advancing observability and reliability through robust logging, metrics, tracing, and profiling solutions. The products your team delivers will support developers and operational teams across King, ensuring optimal performance and health of our game platform.
   

  

 You’ll collaborate closely with engineering teams, influencing strategies around how we monitor all King games and services across our Public Cloud footprint, while championing best practices in DevOps and Site Reliability Engineering.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
 Lead, motivate and inspire a team of passionate engineers that own and operate the observability platform at King.
   

  

 Lead both technical strategy and product management within Observability, driving product vision and execution.
   

  

 Build and evolve solutions for observability leveraging Grafana (collector and dashboarding), Loki (logs), Mimir (metrics), and Pyroscope (profiling).
   

  

 Act as an ambassador for on-call practices, leveraging PagerDuty for incident management and promoting robust reliability engineering culture.
   

  

 Drive adoption and best practices for Site Reliability Engineering.
   

  

 Collaborate effectively across King to understand business needs and align technical deliverables.
   

  

 Foster a supportive, inclusive team environment that nurtures career growth and team cohesion.
   

  

 Skills to Create Thrills
   

  

 7+ years leading and motivating high performing engineering teams.
   

  

 Deep expertise in cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
   

  

 Strong understanding of observability tools and concepts, including metrics, logs, traces, and profiling.
   

  

 Practical experience with Grafana, Loki, Mimir, Pyroscope, and PagerDuty.
   

  

 Solid experience managing technical teams, driving product roadmaps, and managing stakeholder expectations.
   

  

 Proven leadership in creating a healthy engineering culture emphasizing collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement.
   

  

 Excellent strategic thinking, capable of independently contributing to King’s broader technology and product strategies.
   

  

**Healthy Team**
 Ability to build and maintain a structured, high-performing team with clearly defined roles aligned with strategic priorities.
   

  

 Demonstrated success in mentoring team members, fostering communication, and embedding a collaborative and service-oriented mindset.
   

  

**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Data Analytics Engineer
description:
Are you ready to be a key contributor within the Data & Analytics Engineering department at NOBA Bank Group? Your focus will be on advancing analytics capabilities, optimizing data workflows, driving innovation in the cloud, and unlocking the full potential of the organization’s most valuable asset – data.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Data & Analytics Engineering department comprises specialized teams focused on Data Infrastructure Engineering, Analytics Engineering, and Data Management.
   

  

 As a Data Analytics Engineer, you'll play a central role in building and optimizing the organization's supporting analytics layer, collaborating across the bank. This role offers broad opportunities to grow and make a tangible impact!
   

  

 We offer a hybrid working model with two common in-office days. While we value flexibility, we also prioritize collaboration, team-building, and enjoying fikas and after-work gatherings together!
   

  

**Main Tasks**
* Design and implement efficient data models, focusing on analytics workflows and end-user usability.
* Build robust and scalable data pipelines to support business intelligence and analytics needs.
* Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders, such as Risk, Finance, and IT, to ensure data solutions align with business needs.
* Ensure data quality, security, and compliance throughout the analytics lifecycle.
* Drive technical improvements, introducing modern tools and processes to enhance analytics capabilities.
* Partner with other engineers to align transformation processes for analytics purposes.


**We Are Looking For Someone Who**
 Enjoys working with data & analytics engineering, modern data practices, and creating insights that drive decisions. We believe you are a detail-oriented and proactive person who thrives in a collaborative environment and enjoy learning new technologies. You approach challenges with a “can-do” attitude and excel in analytical thinking and problem-solving. For this role you’ll need:
   

  

* Work experience in a similar role within data engineering or analytics engineering
* An academic degree related to analytics engineering, data engineering, or similar fields.
* Proficiency in ETL processes, designing analytics-ready datasets, and ensuring clean and usable data for stakeholders.
* Proficiency in Databricks, dbt (SQL), python and related reporting tools and languages.
* Experience with Power BI or similar BI tools.
* Strong English skills, with proficiency in Swedish and/or Norwegian.


**It’s a Plus If You Have**
* Experience with Microsoft’s data stack (Azure, SQL, and other cloud services).
* A background in data roles within the financial sector.
* Knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies.


**Our Offer To You**
* Freedom with Responsibility: Flexible working arrangements to suit your work style.
* Career Development: Opportunities to grow and develop in your role.
* Feedback Culture: A supportive environment that encourages open communication.
* Coaching Leadership: Managers who guide and support your career journey.
* A Caring Company Culture: We genuinely care about each other!


 In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values:
 **we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead.**
**Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?**
 In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra
 *bubbly* 
 ! ✨
   

  

 Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page.
   

  

**Read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.**
 We care for your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application, for examples information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health.
   

  

**Read more about how we handle your personal data here.**
 If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application! 🙏✨

title: AI/ML Developer
description:
**An Amazing Career Opportunity for an** 
**AI/ML Developer !!**
**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden; hybrid
   

  

**Job ID:** 
 41789
   

  

 Join a forward-thinking engineering team where innovation meets impact. We're looking for an AI/ML Developer with deep expertise in data science and machine learning to design, build, and deploy production-grade models across cloud and on-prem environments. If you're passionate about solving real-world problems with AI and thrive in fast-paced, hands-on development, this is your opportunity to make a difference.
   

  

**Who are we?**
 HID powers the trusted identities of the world’s people, places, and things, allowing people to transact safely, work productively and travel freely.
   

  

 We are a high-tech software company headquartered in Austin, TX, with over 4,500 worldwide employees. Check us out here: www.hidglobal.com and https://youtu.be/23km5H4K9Eo
   

  

**Identity and Access Management Solutions (IAMS):**
 HID Global IAM products protect more than 85 million user identities.
   

  

 HID Global Identity and Access Management Solutions products protect more than 85 million user identities. At HID Global, we understand that no person, device, or workplace can go unprotected. This philosophy of Zero Trust drives us to create new advances in risk-based multi-factor authentication, leads us to secure user identities in converged access environments and drives the need to expand implementations with our industry-leading digital certificates and PKIaaS solution to manage them at scale.
   

  

**As our** 
**AI/ML Developer** 
**, you’ll support HID’s success by:**
* Collaborating closely with the AI Center of Excellence, AI teams, and product teams to align development efforts with strategic goals.
* Designing, implementing, and deploying machine learning models for production use cases (classification, anomaly detection, NLP, and fraud detection).
* Building and maintaining data pipelines, ETL processes, and feature stores for scalable ML experimentation.
* Working with cloud platforms (AWS SageMaker, GCP, Snowflake, Kafka, Docker, Jenkins) to deliver end-to-end AI/ML solutions.
* Developing APIs and microservices to integrate ML models with business applications.
* Conducting experiments with LLMs, multi-agent systems, and synthetic data generation for advanced use cases.
* Ensuring model observability, explainability, and compliance with industry and regulatory standards.
* Collaborating cross-functionally with product, engineering, and business teams to translate requirements into ML-driven solutions.
* Documenting models, processes, and experiments; conducting knowledge transfer and support audits or due diligence.


**Your Experience and Background include:**
* 5+ years of experience in AI/ML, Data Science, or related fields.
* Proven track record in Python development with strong knowledge of NumPy, pandas, scikit-learn, XGBoost, and ML frameworks.
* Experience with AWS Machine Learning ecosystem (SageMaker, boto3, CloudWatch) .
* Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with data warehouses (Snowflake, BigQuery).
* Hands-on with CI/CD, MLOps, and DataOps practices.
* Experience deploying models in Flask/Docker/Jenkins environments.
* Exposure to LLMs, RAG architectures, and AI workflow automation (LangChain, n8n, neo4j) .
* Strong understanding of data governance, quality assurance, and regulatory reporting.
* MSc in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related technical field.
* Experience working in agile environments and familiarity with cross-functional collaboration.
* Strong focus on user-centered design and iterative development.
* Experience with A/B testing, BI tools (Tableau), and anomaly detection systems.
* Knowledge of responsible AI practices and security standards (OWASP) .
* Committed continuous learner who actively keeps up with the latest developments in AI/ML and is always eager to share insights and knowledge across the organization.
* Strong advocate for diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace.
* Results-oriented, with the ability to balance technical depth with business acumen.
* Language Skills
* Ability to effectively communicate in English, both verbally and in writing.
* Proficient in reading and interpreting technical documentation, including journals, specifications, and international standards.


**What we can offer you:**
* Competitive salary and rewards package
* Competitive benefits and annual leave offering, allowing for work-life balance
* A vibrant, welcoming & inclusive culture
* Extensive career development opportunities and resources to maximize your potential
* To be a part of a global organization that is pioneering the hardware, software and services that allow people to confidently navigate the physical and digital worlds


**Why apply?**
* Empowerment: You’ll work as part of a global team in a flexible work environment, learning and enhancing your expertise. We welcome an opportunity to meet you and learn about your unique talents, skills, and experiences. You don’t need to check all the boxes. If you have most of the skills and experience, we want you to apply.
* Innovation: You embrace challenges and want to drive change. We are open to ideas, including flexible work arrangements, job sharing or part-time job seekers.
* Integrity: You are results-orientated, reliable, and straightforward and value being treated accordingly. We want all our employees to be themselves, to feel appreciated and accepted.


 HID is committed to building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce that reflects the global communities we serve. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We evaluate applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. Our goal is to create a workplace that empowers everyone to thrive and be their authentic selves, fostering an environment of mutual respect and inclusivity. If you have a disability and require assistance or accommodation to participate in the application process or to perform essential job functions, please contact accommodations-ext@hidglobal.com .
   

  

**We make it easier for people to get where they want to go!**
 On an average day, think of how many times you tap, twist, tag, push or swipe to get access, find information, connect with others or track something. HID technology is behind billions of interactions, in more than 100 countries. We help you create a verified, trusted identity that can get you where you need to go – without having to think about it.
   

  

 When you join our HID team, you’ll also be part of the ASSA ABLOY Group, the global leader in access solutions. You’ll have 63,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally. As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Field Service Engineer - Copenhagen, Denmark
description:
**Work Schedule**


Standard (Mon-Fri)**Environmental Conditions**


Able to lift 40 lbs. without assistance, Will work with hazardous/toxic materials**Job Description**


Join Thermo Fisher Scientific, a global leader valuing performance, quality, and innovation.

**Location/Division Specific Information**
------------------------------------------


Location: Copenhagen area, Denmark  

Main focus is a key account in the Copenhagen area

**Division: Laboratory Automation**
-----------------------------------


Discover Impactful Work


Repair, maintain, and install Cytomat Products, Digital Science and Automation Solutions (DSAS) products, and 3rd party equipment in Europe.

**A day in the Life:**
----------------------

* Schedule and perform on-site maintenance, repair and installation on all Cytomat Products and other LAI system components and instrumentation.
* Perform on-site training relative to system service, maintenance, and basic operation.
* Keep track and maintain your local spare part's inventory.
* Ensure that all documentation related to in-house and on-site support activity is completed accurately and submitted on a timely basis. This includes maintenance of electronic files, Field Service Reports, Service Work Orders and Quotes.
* Diagnose problems over the phone and/or using remote software. Where necessary, follow up with on-site work or dispatch third-party service providers for on-site work. Follow up to ensure problems were resolved to the customer’s happiness.
* Actively monitor the status of contract, warranty and time and material installed customers.

**Keys to Success**
-------------------


Education

* Technology diploma in Mechatronics, Electro-mechanical engineering, Electrical or Mechanical engineering, or equivalent.

**Experience**
--------------

* Minimum 5 years practical experience in field service or solving software and lab equipment.
* Validated experience with automation, robots, and/or device instrumentation.

**Knowledge, Skills, Abilities**
--------------------------------

* System-level diagnostic skills using inquiries, observations, system schematics & documentation, software tools, and communications / electrical diagnostic aids.
* Multi-disciplinary technical skills / excellent with software, electrical, and mechanical systems.
* Proficient in computer use, skilled in serial communications cabling, and familiar with basic programming concepts.
* Wiring and pneumatics (schematics, PLCs, power panels).
* Mechanical systems (CAD drawings, fasteners).
* Working proficiency of Momentum software features and operations is a plus.
* Excellent interpersonal communication skills, must have a professional working proficiency in English, additional languages advantageous.
* Strong written and verbal communications skills and shown ability to meet targets and work independently in a quick-paced environment.


You will receive a competitive salary, company car, company pension scheme and will have outstanding development and career prospects in a globally growing company.


Discover 5 reasons to join our team of 100,000+ colleagues worldwide.

**A day in the Life:**
----------------------

* Schedule and perform on-site maintenance, repair and installation on all Cytomat Products and other LAI system components and instrumentation.
* Perform on-site training relative to system service, maintenance, and basic operation.
* Keep track and maintain your local spare part's inventory.
* Ensure that all documentation related to in-house and on-site support activity is completed accurately and submitted on a timely basis. This includes maintenance of electronic files, Field Service Reports, Service Work Orders and Quotes.
* Diagnose problems over the phone and/or using remote software. Where necessary, follow up with on-site work or dispatch third-party service providers for on-site work. Follow up to ensure problems were resolved to the customer’s happiness.
* Actively monitor the status of contract, warranty and time and material installed customers.

**Keys to Success**
-------------------


Education

* Technology diploma in Mechatronics, Electro-mechanical engineering, Electrical or Mechanical engineering, or equivalent.

**Experience**
--------------

* Minimum 5 years practical experience in field service or solving software and lab equipment.
* Validated experience with automation, robots, and/or device instrumentation.

**Knowledge, Skills, Abilities**
--------------------------------

* System-level diagnostic skills using inquiries, observations, system schematics & documentation, software tools, and communications / electrical diagnostic aids.
* Multi-disciplinary technical skills / excellent with software, electrical, and mechanical systems.
* Proficient in computer use, skilled in serial communications cabling, and familiar with basic programming concepts.
* Wiring and pneumatics (schematics, PLCs, power panels).
* Mechanical systems (CAD drawings, fasteners).
* Working proficiency of Momentum software features and operations is a plus.
* Excellent interpersonal communication skills, must have a professional working proficiency in English, additional languages advantageous.
* Strong written and verbal communications skills and shown ability to meet targets and work independently in a quick-paced environment.


You will receive a competitive salary, company car, company pension scheme and will have outstanding development and career prospects in a globally growing company.


Discover 5 reasons to join our team of 100,000+ colleagues worldwide.
company_description: At Thermo Fisher Scientific, our professionals develop critical solutions—and build rewarding careers.

title: Platform Engineer till Accelerate at Iver
description:
Är du redo att forma framtidens IT tillsammans med några av branschens vassaste konsulter? Accelerate at Iver växer – och vi söker fler Platform Engineers som vill vara med och bygga smarta, hållbara och säkra lösningar i teknikens absoluta framkant.
   

  

****💼** 
**Din roll****
 Som en del av vårt DevOps-team får du arbeta med marknadsledande kunder och hjälpa dem genom deras digitala transformation. Du jobbar långsiktigt i teamleveranser med modernisering, automation och agil utveckling – enligt vår metodik
 *Journey* 
 to Agile. Några av de tekniker/metoder som vi arbetar med är Kubernetes, Docker, Terraform, Jenkins, Ansible, Git, Bash, Python.
   

  

******✅** 
 Vem är du?****
 Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet inom Plattform/DevOps och som brinner för automatisering och att bygga effektiva lösningar ute hos våra kunder. Du uttrycker dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.
   

  

 För denna position krävs svenskt medborgarskap, vi utför även bakgrundskontroll av slutkandidat.
   

  

**🛠️ Du Bör Ha Koll På**
* Linux i enterprise-miljöer
* Containerteknik: Docker, Kubernetes
* Script/programmering: Bash, Python, Go
* Versionshantering: Git
* Automatisering: Ansible, Terraform
* CI/CD och GitOps


**Extra Plus Om Du Även Har Koll På**
* OpenStack
* Public cloud
* OpenShift/Rancher
* HashiCorp Vault/Consul


****🌱** 
**Vi** 
 erbjuder dig**
 Som anställd på Accelerate at Iver erbjuder vi förutom spännande uppdrag och tekniker:
   

  

* Utbildning & certifieringar via våra partners (Red Hat, HashiCorp, GitLab m.fl.)
* En trygg och säker anställning med bra förmåner
* Kollektivavtal, friskvårdsbidrag och sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Flexibilitet, frihet och balans mellan jobb och fritid
* Att bli en del i ett passionerat team med tekniskt vassa kollegor


 Vi tror på gemenskap och kompetensutbyte – här utvecklas vi tillsammans och stöttar varandra för att alltid ligga i framkant.
   

  

**📍Placeringsort**
 Accelerate at Iver finns på flertal orter i Sverige och Norge. För denna tjänst utgår du från vårt kontor i Stockholm, med möjlighet till hybridarbete.
   

  

**Vi intervjuar löpande – vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan!**
 👉 Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Har du frågor? Kontakta Jesper Carlsson på jesper.carlsson@iver.se
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot att träffa dig. Välkommen til** 
**l Accelerate at Iver!** 
 🚀
